title: Jesus the Cruciform Anti-Hero Hero
summary: Paul presents a rough draft of his upcoming Sunday sermon where he discusses the concept of heroism and the surprising message of Jesus. He contrasts Jesus with historical figures like Alexander the Great and Caesar, highlighting Jesus as a different kind of hero. The Transfiguration event is discussed, emphasizing the unconventional path Jesus takes as he challenges traditional ideas of power and heroism. Jesus instructs his disciples to take up their cross and follow him, emphasizing the transformative nature of his message. Jesus's message disrupts traditional notions of heroism and power, pointing towards a different kind of Kingdom.
